[14_Imotil___]
Imotil
Loperamide Hydrochloride USP
COMPOSITION
Imotil capsule: Each capsule contains Loperamide Hydrochloride USP 2 mg.
colitis or pseudomembranous colitis associated with broad spectrum antibiotics. It should not be
used alone in acute dysentery associated with blood in stools and elevated temperature.
PHARMACOLOGY
It should be used with caution in patients with defective hepatic function as this might result in a
Loperamide (Imotil) is orally administered capsule. After administration absorption is more than relative overdose.
65% which occurs at a modest rate, with peak serum levels of 2-3 mg/litre occurring at about 4
hours later after oral administration. The rest 35% is excreted unchanged in the faeces. SIDE EFFECT
Loperamide undergoes an extensive presystemic first pass metabolism in the gut wal and in the On occasions paralytic ileus, abdominal cramps and bloating have been reported. Other side

[14_Imotil___]
liver. Loperamide does not act centrally due o its high affinity for the gut wall and its
effects observed are skin reactions including urticaria, nausea, vomiting, constipation, tiredness,
presystemic metabolism. This is why it reaches the systemic circulation in very minute amount. drowsiness, dizziness and dry mouth.
The route of elimination is 0.63-1.4% in urine as unchanged drug, 58% is excreted in the bile
and 15-23% appears in the faeces.
DRUG INTERACTION
Loperamide inhibits the peristaltic activity of longitudinal and circular smooth muscle in the No drugs are known to be incompatible with Imotil.
intestine by interacting with cholinergic and noncholinergic neuronal mechanisms responsible
for producing the peristaltic reflex. Loperamide binds o the opiate receptor in the gut wall,
USE NI PREGNANCY AND LACTATION
reducing propulsive peristalsis, and increase intestinal transit time.
Safety of use of Loperamide during pregnancy has not been established, although studies in

[14_Imotil___]
Safety of use of Loperamide during pregnancy has not been established, although studies in
animal did not demonstrate any teratogenic effects. Therefore, it should not be administered to
INDICATION
the patients during pregnancy. Although the fraction of loperamide secreted in the human milk is
Imotil is indicated as a symptomatic treatment of acute and chronic diarrhea.
very low, caution is advised if it is to be administered l nursing mothers.
DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
STORAGE
Acute diarrhea:
Store below 30°C. Protect from light & moisture.
The initial dose is 2 capsules for adults and 1 capsule for children older than eight; in addition 1
Keep out of Children's reach.
capsule should be taken at any subsequent loose stool.
The daily dose, however should not exceed 8 capsules for adults, for children 4-6 capsules
HOW SUPPLIED
according to age.
Imotil capsule: Box containing 200 capsules in blister pack.
Chronic diarrhea:
Initial dose:
Adults: 2 capsules daily.

[14_Imotil___]
Chronic diarrhea:
Initial dose:
Adults: 2 capsules daily.
Children: Older than eight: 1 capsule daily.
Maintenance dose:
One should aim at obtaining normal stools (e.g., one or two stools of poob consistency a day).
For this it may be necessary to adjust the initial dose (by increasing or decreasing a as
required).
Maintenance dose as a rule will vary from 1 to 9 capsules daily.
Manufactured by
CONTRAINDICATION AND PRECAUTION
SQUARE
# should not be used in children less than 4 years of age. It must not be used when inhibition of
peristalsis is to be avoided in particular when constipation are present or when abdominal
PHARMACEUTICALS LTD.
distension develops particularly severely dehydrated children or in patients with acute ulcerative
